intro: Covellia cunia, commonly known as the mountain violet, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Covellia cunia is valued in horticulture for its resilience and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
